body.p:
Franklin County June 2d 1865
Col W T Scott,
Dr Sir,

I enclose you a letter, I received yesterday, from a young friend of mine, who has peculier claims on me, & if you can do anything for him, I will regard it as a personal favor -- he is quite a youth, and has been a prisoner over two years -- I have so few friends, who have any influence, with the powers that be, I at first despaired of accomplishing any thing for him -- It has just occurred to me, that you could help me, & I did not doubt your willingness to do so I am sure Gov Bramlette could, & would, have him released, if you would call his attention to the case -- I have been told that it is very little trouble --
